creation_date: Ptolemaic Period (c. 310 BC -30 BC), Ptolemaic Dynasty
title: Statuette of a Falcon, Standing with Double Crown
description: This hollow cast, votive statuette depicts a falcon, the sacred animal of Horus. The falcon stands in hieroglyphic form -body upright, legs together. On his head he wears the double crown of Upper and Lower Egypt. The Horus falcon was a traditional symbol of Egyptian kingship. During the Ptolemaic period, statuettes of this type were most often dedicated at sacred animal necropoleis, such as the one N. Saqqara.
